Asian Games.passage: The Asian Games is a multi-sport event involving athletes from countries in and around East Asia. Held every four years, it is among the largest international sporting events in the world. The first Asian Games were held in 1951 in New Delhi, India, and the last in 2006 in Doha, Qatar. The Asian Games Federation (AGF) is responsible for organizing the Games.

Asian Para Games.passage:
Asian Para Games

The Asian Para Games (APG) are a multi-sport event for athletes with a disability that is held every four years, with the first games held in 1990 in Seoul, South Korea. The games are sanctioned by the International Paralympic Committee (IPC), and Asian Games Federation (AGF)

Originally, the games were known as Asian-Pacific Para Games. The name was changed to the current name in 1997. The games are held every four years, in a country different from that of the previous games. The first four games were held in China (1990), Malaysia (1994), Thailand (1998), and Indonesia (2002). The most recent games were held in Vietnam (2016). The first games had a total of 672 athletes from 11 countries.

qae_pairs.question: Which country hosted the first Asian Para Games?
qae_pairs.explanation: The first Asian Para Games, also known as Asian-Pacific Para Games, was held in China in 1990.

qae_pairs.explanation: The most recent Asian Para Games were held in Vietnam in 2016.

qae_pairs.explanation: The Asian Para Games are sanctioned by the International Paralympic Committee (IPC), and Asian Games Federation (AGF).

qae_pairs.explanation: The first Asian Para Games were held in Seoul, South Korea in 1990.

qae_pairs.explanation: The first Asian Para Games was held in 1990 in Seoul, South Korea.

qae_pairs.question: Which country hosted the most recent Asian Para Games?
qae_pairs.explanation: The most recent Asian Para Games were held in Vietnam in 2016.

Commonwealth Games.passage: The Commonwealth Games (formerly the British Empire and Commonwealth Games and British Empire and Commonwealth Games) is an international multi-sport event involving athletes from the Commonwealth of Nations. It is held every four years, with the Commonwealth Games Federation (CGF) selecting the host city. The Games have been held every four years since 1930, except in 1966 when they were postponed to 1970 due to the Commonwealth Games Federation's inability to find a host city.

qae_pairs.question: What year was the Commonwealth Games postponed to?
qae_pairs.explanation: The Commonwealth Games was postponed to 1970 due to the Commonwealth Games Federation's inability to find a host city.

FIFA World Cup.passage: The FIFA World Cup, sometimes called the Football World Cup or the Soccer World Cup,[a] is an international association football competition contested by the men's national teams of the members of FIFA, the sport's global governing body. The championship has been awarded every four years since 1930, except in 1942 and during the 1940s and 1950s when it was halted due to the Second World War. The tournament consists of two parts: the qualification phase and the final phase (officially named the World Cup Finals). The qualification phase, which takes place over the three years preceding the finals, is used to determine which teams will join the 26 that qualified automatically for the final phase. The current format of the World Cup finals features 32 teams, divided into eight groups of three teams each, with each team playing each other once in a round-robin style tournament. The top two teams in each group advance to the quarter-finals. The World Cup final itself, the ultimate knockout tournament match, is played between the two winning teams. The first World Cup was held in 1930 in Uruguay. The current champions are France, who won the title in Russia in 2018.

qae_pairs.explanation: The first World Cup was held in 1930 in Uruguay.

FIFA World Cup closing match.passage: After a scoreless first half, the United States took the lead on a header from Clint Dempsey in the 53rd minute, but Mexico equalized with a goal from Javier Hernández in the 80th minute. The United States regained the lead in the 90th minute, but Mexico's Héctor Moreno scored a stoppage time equalizer to send the match to extra time. In the second half of extra time, the U.S. took the lead again on a goal from Dempsey in the 111th minute, but again Mexico came back with two goals, the second from Hernández in the 117th minute, and the third from Oribe Peralta in the 119th minute, to win 3–2 and send the United States to their first ever loss in the World Cup.

China.passage: China (simplified Chinese: 中国; traditional Chinese: 中國; pinyin: Zhōngguó; Foochow Romanized: Tzung-gwok3), officially the People's Republic of China (PRC) (中华人民共和国), is a sovereign state in East Asia. With a population of over 1.381 billion, it is the most populous country in the world. The state is governed by the Communist Party of China, and its capital city is Beijing. It exercises jurisdiction over 22 provinces, five autonomous regions, four direct-controlled municipalities (Beijing, Shanghai, Tianjin, and Chongqing) and two mostly self-governing special administrative regions (Hong Kong and Macau), and is one of the world's Four Great Powers along with the Russian Federation, the United States, and India.

the Olympic Council of Asia.passage: The Olympic Council of Asia (OCA) is the second largest international sports organization in the world after the International Olympic Committee (IOC), and is the continental confederation of the Olympic Games. France.passage: France (French: [fʁɑ̃s]), officially the French Republic, is a country with territory in western Europe and several overseas territories. France is also a state and a founding member of the European Union (EU). It is bordered by Italy to the northwest, Belgium and Luxembourg to the north, Germany to the east, Spain to the southeast, and the Atlantic Ocean to the south. The Mediterranean Sea is to the south, the North Sea to the east and the English Channel and the Atlantic Ocean to the south and west, respectively. The non-oceanic territory of France extends to the north Atlantic Ocean in the Arctic Ocean. France, the largest country in the European Union, has its continental territory the second-largest in Europe after Russia.

the Soccer World Cup.passage: The World Cup, known as the FIFA World Cup until 2026, is an international association football tournament contested by the men's national teams of the members of Fédération Internationale de Football Association (FIFA), the sport's global governing body. The championship has been awarded every four years since the first tournament in 1930, except in 1942 and 1946 when it was not held due to World War II. The current champion is France, who won the title for the 2022 tournament. The format of the competition involves a qualification phase, which currently requires national teams to progress through several rounds on the basis of their performance in their own national championships to reach the final stage. Once the final stage teams are known, the remaining teams are allocated into groups based on their continental zones. The teams then play their opponents in their group in a round robin format, usually home and away, over a total of six games, after which the top two teams progress to the knockout stage. From the knockout stage, the teams then play in one-off matches until a single winner remains. The final has taken place every year since 1990.

qae_pairs.question: Write a question about the Soccer World Cup such as the following one: What is the name of the tournament where the final is held every year since 1990?

Clint Dempsey.passage: Clint Dempsey (born September 29, 1983) is an American professional soccer player. He is currently a player for the Houston Dynamo of Major League Soccer (MLS) and is also a member of the United States men's national soccer team, having previously represented the United States at the FIFA World Cup. Dempsey began his career with Fulham, where he rose through the youth ranks before being sold on to Tottenham Hotspur in 2007. Egypt.passage: Egypt (i/ɛˈdʒɪbiə, -ˈdʒɪbi-, US /iˈdʒɪbiə/; Arabic: المصري‎ ‎ ‎ ‎ ‎, al-Masreyya, Egyptian Arabic: مصر‎ ‎ ‎ ‎, Misr; Egyptian pronunciation: [mɛsriˈjɪ]), officially the Arab Republic of Egypt (أريقة إمارات الإفريق‎ ‎, Urayqah Ismat al-Ifriqi) and colloquially Masr (مصر‎ ‎ ), is a country located along the northeast corner of Africa and the Middle East. It is a transcontinental country spanning across the north coast of the Sinai Peninsula and the northern coast of the Red Sea, and is bordered by the Gaza Strip and Israel to the north, the Palestinian territories of the Gaza Strip and West Bank to the east, Sudan to the southwest, and Sudan and Libya to the southeast. Egypt is a Mediterranean country, with a vast majority of its territory being desert.

qae_pairs.explanation: Egypt has a border with Israel.

qae_pairs.question: Which of the following is true about Egypt?
qae_pairs.explanation: Egypt is bordered by the Red Sea to the north.

qae_pairs.question: What is the capital of the country that borders Egypt to the south?
qae_pairs.explanation: Egypt has a Mediterranean coastline, and is bordered by Libya to the south.

African Nations Cup.passage: The CAF African Nations Cup, also called African Nations Championship, is a biennial international men's football championship in Africa organised by the Confederation of African Football (CAF) since 1963. It was preceded by the African Cup of Nations, first held in 1957 and discontinued in the early 1990s due to the expansion of the FIFA World Cup.

qae_pairs.question: How many years after the first African Cup of Nations was the African Nations Cup first held?
qae_pairs.explanation: The CAF African Nations Cup, also called African Nations Championship, is a biennial international men's football championship in Africa organised by the Confederation of African Football (CAF) since 1963.

qae_pairs.question: Which year was the first African Nations Cup held?
qae_pairs.explanation: The first African Nations Cup was held in 1957.

qae_pairs.question: What is the African Nations Cup?
qae_pairs.explanation: The CAF African Nations Cup, also called African Nations Championship, is a biennial international men's football championship in Africa organised by the Confederation of African Football (CAF) since 1963.

qae_pairs.question: Which organization is the African Nations Cup organized by?
qae_pairs.explanation: The CAF African Nations Cup, also called African Nations Championship, is a biennial international men's football championship in Africa organised by the Confederation of African Football (CAF) since 1963.
